oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Ray Benson - 2018-09-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Ray Benson from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 15, 2018. Includes questions from the audience assisted by Michael McCall. Presented in support of the exhibit Outlaws & Armadillos: Country’s Roaring ’70s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Benson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (05:53) Opening comments and introduction by Michael McCall / (09:46) Ray talks about his guitar / (10:55) Performs A Little Piece / (15:12) Michael asks about how often Ray does solo performances and he talks about his guitar playing and songwriting / (15:56) Ray introduces the next song / (16:10) Performs Hot Like That / (18:57) Answers question about the difference between jazz music and western swing/country music and tells about his musical history / (26:55) Introduces the next song / (28:43) Performs The Letter That Johnny Walker Read / (31:22) Ray talks about the last song and tells a story about touring after the last song became a hit / (32:21) Performs song excerpt of The Letter That Johnny Walker Read with alternate lyrics / (34:44) Answers question about his high school times in Philadelphia / (36:49) Introduces the next song / () Performs You Got To Dance With Who Brung You / (40:18) Michael and Ray talk about Texas football coach Darrell Royal and the Outlaws and Armadillos exhibit / (42:18) Ray tells story about touring with Stoney Edwards and the early days of Asleep At The Wheel / (45:12) Introduces the next song / (45:55) Performs Dublin Blues / (49:54) Closing comments / (50:50) Walk-out music / (52:10) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Benson, Ray, 1951- ; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
